questions.text: A 40-year-old man comes with a 2-year history of urinating up to 20 times each day. He has not had any dysuria or nocturia. He has been evaluated by several urologists but has not received a specific diagnosis or treatment despite extensive diagnostic testing and various pharmacologic treatments. MSE shows a depressed mood and constricted affect. Which is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Somatic symptom Disorder Somatic symptom disorder is a condition in which a patient has persistent somatic symptoms (e.g., headache, fatigue) that result in excessive thoughts and/or behaviors that disrupt daily life . This patient appears anxious and has weakness and an unsteady gait. However, a diagnosis of somatic symptom disorder requires symptoms to persist for ≥ 6 months.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Illness anxiety disorder manifests with excessive health-related behaviors (e.g., frequent evaluation and extensive diagnostic testing) and preoccupation related to illness despite having no physical symptoms . This patient's frequent urination is a significant physical symptom. Option: B . Malingering is characterized by feigned symptoms or false claims of having an illness to obtain secondary gain (e.g., time off from work). Option: C. Atypical depression is diagnosed in individuals with depression, mood reactivity, and physical complaints without an identifiable somatic cause. An increased need for sleep and leaden paralysis are the characteristic features, but patients may also present with pain and generalized discomfort, none of which is seen in this patient.

questions.text: A 25 -year-old man comes with a 1-year history of chronic back pain, abdominal bloating, and feeling of constipation. He has sought multiple physicians but no diagnosis is established. After researching, he is concerned that he might have pancreatic cancer and would like to undergo a CT scan for reassurance. His vital signs, physical and neurologic examinations, lab studies and X Ray Spine shows no abnormalities. Which is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Somatic symptom disorder This patient's presentation is most consistent with somatic symptom disorder. Individuals with this disorder show a preoccupation with their health and develop significant distress and fear of severe illness over benign symptoms. This patient's diagnostic workup did not reveal any known medical etiology of his chronic back pain. In patients with somatic symptom disorder, anxiety typically persists despite reassurance by health care professionals and often leads to patients pursuing extensive diagnostic testing, undergoing unnecessary medical procedures, and frequently changing physicians.

Random:

Explanation for Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Illness anxiety disorder manifests with excessive health-related behaviors (e.g., frequent evaluation and extensive diagnostic testing) and preoccupation related to illness despite having no physical symptoms . Option: B. Since these cancers are commonly atypical until later disease stages, other symptoms such as weight loss or fatigue would also be expected. Option: D. Individuals with conversion disorder suffer from a range of neurological symptoms (e.g., altered sensory function) that cannot be attributed to a neurological condition. Affected individuals are not preoccupied with their health . This patient does not report any neurological symptoms, ruling out this diagnosis.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman presents with a 1-year history of headaches and blurry vision. Despite a repeat negative neurologic evaluation, the patient is concerned that she has not been treated appropriately. She volunteers that real trouble began for her at age 16 when she had surgery for presumed endometriosis. Since the surgery, she has had intermittent abdominal cramping, bloating, and diarrhea. Three months ago, she saw a rheumatologist for knee, back, and eye pain. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Somatization Disorder Somatization disorder is characterized by a variety of somatic complaints that cannot be verified by laboratory and physical findings .

Highyeild:

The disorder has its onset before age 30 and is more common in women than in men. Diagnosis is based on the occurrence of four pain symptoms , two gastrointestinal symptoms, one sexual symptom, and one pseudo-neurologic symptom . It is important to determine that these symptoms are not intentionally produced or feigned for other purposes.

Explanation for Incorrect Options:- Option: A & B. Malingering and Factitious Disorder involves falsification of manifestations of illness to attain secondary and primary gain There is no indication that this patient is intentionally falsifying her symptoms. Option: D. Although tension-type headache can be present with regard to multiple other somatic complaints given by the patient and asking the most likely diagnosis in question, are more in favor of somatization disorder.

questions.text: A male patient suffers from osteoarthritic knee pain, but he believes it is caused by ‘the leader of a cybernetic extermination gang’ in an attempt to robotize him. On taking an examination, he has no pain complaints except in the knee and no gastric complaints. Which of these is the correct explanation of the symptoms in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Somatic passivity Somatic passivity refers to the experience of sensations in one's body believed to be caused by some external agency and the belief that outside influences are playing on the body .

Highyeild:

For example, a kinaesthetic hallucination occurred with a passivity experience given as an explanation by a patient who felt that their hand was being drawn up to their face. They could feel it moving, although, in fact, it was motionless. Somatic passivity may also occur in association with a normal percept, such as osteoarthritic knee pain, ascribed to be caused by an external agency, as in this case ; these experiences are quite common in schizophrenia . It is not the same as haptic hallucination, but it is a delusional belief that the body is being influenced from outside the self. It may occur in association with various somatic hallucinations.

Option C: Somatization disorder is characterized by a variety of somatic complaints that cannot be verified by laboratory and physical findings . Diagnosis is based on the occurrence of four pain symptoms , two gastrointestinal symptoms, one sexual symptom, and one pseudoneurological symptom . Option D: Body dysmorphic disorder is characterized by a preoccupation with an imagined defect in appearance that causes clinically significant distress or impairment in important areas of functioning.

questions.text: A 30-year-old female presents with a history of cough, increased urination, infrequent headaches, and difficulty in breathing for 5 months. She feels that she might have tuberculosis and visits every 2 months for examination. All the examination is normal. True statements about the etiology of this condition are: Patients may focus on bodily sensations, misinterpret them and become alarmed by faulty cognitive schemes. The sick role offers an escape that allows a patient to avoid noxious obligations, postpone unwelcome challenges, and be excused from usual duties and obligations. Aggressive and hostile wishes towards others are transferred into physical complaints. It could be a defense against guilt. Select the correct answer from given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2, 3 and 4 The given case history points towards Somatic symptom disorder . Somatic symptom disorder, also known as hypochondriasis . It is characterized by 6 or more months of a general and nondelusional preoccupation with fears of having, or the idea that one has, a serious disease based on the person's misinterpretation of bodily symptoms . THEREFORE ALL THE STATEMENTS ARE CORRECT REGARDING SOMATIC SYMPTOM DISORDER.

Random:

Explanation of Statements:- Statement 1. Patients may focus on bodily sensations, misinterpret them and become alarmed by faulty cognitive schemes is seen in sommatic symptom disorder. Statement 2 . The sick role offers an escape that allows a patient to avoid noxious obligations, postpone unwelcome challenges, and be excused from usual duties and obligations is seen in sommatic symptom disorder. Statement 3. Aggressive and hostile wishes towards others are transferred into physical complaints is seen in sommatic symptom disorder. Statement 4. It could be a defense against guilt.

Extraedge:

This disorder is also viewed as a defense against guilt , a sense of innate badness, an expression of low self-esteem, and a sign of excessive self-concern. Pain and somatic suffering thus become means of atonement and expiation ( undoing ) and can be experienced as deserved punishment for past wrongdoing (either real or imaginary) and for a person's sense of wickedness and sinfulness.

questions.text: A 20-year-old woman comes to her primary care doctor with multiple symptoms which are present across several organ systems. She has persistently high anxiety due to this and she has seen five doctors in the past 3 months for this and has had six surgeries since the age of 18. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis according to DSM-5?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Somatic symptom disorder The given case history points towards Somatic symptom disorder . Somatic symptom disorder, also known as hypochondriasis . It is characterized by 6 or more months of a general and nondelusional preoccupation with fears of having, or the idea that one has, a serious disease based on the person's misinterpretation of bodily symptoms .

Highyeild:

According to the DSM-5, individuals with somatic symptom disorder present with one or more somatic complaints that result in significant angst or functional impairment . Also, they must be anxious about their symptoms or be preoccupied with them. The analogous diagnosis in ICD-10 , as well as in the previous version of the DSM is somatization disorder. The biggest difference between the two concepts is whether there needs to be evidence that there is no underlying medical cause for the disorder—ICD-10 does, and DSM-IV did require this whereas DSM-5 does not.

They present acutely, usually with one symptom, but that symptom may be incompatible with known pathophysiologic mechanisms . Option: C. With an illness anxiety disorder , patients have relatively minor and fewer somatic symptoms and instead focus on concerns that they will get sick or have an undiagnosed illness ; on the other hand, with somatic symptom disorder, there are significant health concerns along with substantial somatic symptoms. The analogous disorder in ICD-10 and the earlier DSM-IV is hypochondriasis . Option: D. Patients with a body dysmorphic disorder tend to be adolescent or young adult women, who have subjective feelings that they are ugly or have some body part that is deformed.

Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient according to DSM-5?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Illness Anxiety Disorder With an illness anxiety disorder , patients have relatively minor and fewer somatic symptoms and instead focus on concerns that they will get sick or have an undiagnosed illness . They are usually temporarily reassured with negative test findings, but soon find another illness to obsess about. The analogous disorder in ICD-10 and the earlier DSM-IV is hypochondriasis .

questions.text: A 66-year-old man with a history of concussion and progressive short-term memory loss presented with selective, remote, and recent memory loss, visual hallucinations, approximation of answers regarding his current state, and limited insight into his condition, oriented only to place and person. His wife passed away three weeks prior. Negative results from imaging and testing and the patient's recent emotional stressor is best diagnosed as Ganser Syndrome. Which of the following statement is FALSE about this syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: It has been seen in prisoners following solitary confinement

options.label: B
options.text: Patient has clouding of consciousness, echolalia, and echopraxia

options.label: D
options.text: It is included under somatoform disorders in ICD10.

questions.correct_answer: D. It is included under somatoform disorders in ICD10.
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It is included under somatoform disorders in ICD10. Ganser syndrome is included under dissociative disorders in ICD 10. It is a poorly understood condition characterized by the giving of approximate answers (paralogia) together with a clouding of consciousness and is frequently accompanied by hallucinations and other dissociative, somatoform, or conversion symptoms.

questions.text: A 20-year-old woman comes to her primary care doctor with multiple symptoms which are present across several organ systems. The physician found no organic cause for her symptoms. Following are historical terms used to describe somatic presentations that have a presumed psychological origin EXCEPT:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Melancholia Melancholia is a subtype of depression . People with melancholic depression often feel extreme despair and guilt . Somatic presentations that have a presumed psychological origin have always mystified the medical establishment and have taken new forms and shapes as cultures evolve and medical paradigms shift.
